definition: to shine (of talents, skills, accomplishment)/to demonstrate extraordinary talent or skill
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
different/other/hetero-/unusual/strange/surprising/to distinguish/to separate/to discriminate
(bright) color/variety/applause/applaud/lottery prize

sentences.english: And make Tianjin caly figurines is to shine is famous of Zhang's Painted caly figurines.
sentences.chinese: 而使得天津泥塑大放异彩的，是“泥人张”的彩塑。

sentences.english: All communication projects will shine brilliantly.
sentences.chinese: 所有沟通项目都将大放异彩。

sentences.english: Moreover, 2NE1′s explosive charisma will shine regardless of the size of the venue.
sentences.chinese: 此外，2NE1的爆炸魅力将大放异彩无论场地大小。

sentences.english: He's a rhythm shooter and he'll have some big nights.
sentences.chinese: 他是个节奏感很强的投手，很多个夜晚都能大放异彩。

sentences.english: Once you light Darwinian evolution, it takes off.
sentences.chinese: 一旦推崇达尔文主义进化论，它会大放异彩。

sentences.english: Explore your partner Leo, shine your light on them this week.
sentences.chinese: 本周好好探索下你的伴侣，在他们身上大放异彩吧。

definition: to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant

to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field
to emerge as a new force to be reckoned with (idiom)
most outstanding/par excellence
to hit the big time
to take it up a notch/to bring it up a level
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
first sign of budding talent/to display one's ability for the first time
remarkable (performance, achievement etc)/worthy of praise
to rise to fame
lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
impressive/out of the ordinary
to advance by leaps and bounds
well-known figure/excellent (person, company etc)
lit. to first show one's horns (idiom); fig. a first show of emerging talent/first sign of emerging talent/budding genius
